results.title: Dune. Episode 2
results.creator_credit: John Kent Harrison, David Kappes, New Amsterdam Entertainment and Sci Fi Channel
results.brief_description: Episode two of the American television mini-series adaptation of Frank Herbert’s cult novel “Dune.” Having ruthlessly taken over the planet Arrakis, Baron Harkonnen hands over the reigns to his brutal nephew Rabban, who instantaneously starts to rule the planet with an iron fist, in contrast to Atreides’ benevolent approach. Atreides’ partner and son, believed dead, have taken refuge in the desert with the Fremen, a nomadic tribe for whom Paul swiftly becomes a leader. Paul strengths as a visionary are increased as he starts to comprehend his destiny and becomes affected by the power of the spice. Back at headquarters the treachery continues amidst those who seek power and glory. Stylishly designed, this series has an impressive aesthetic quality, ably capturing the otherworldliness of the book’s milieu, enhanced by extensive use of CGI. The mini-series format allows for a greater exploration of Herbert’s saga than the film version “Dune” (Lynch, 1984). Like much science fiction, this futuristic tale has medieval and Biblical overtones with exotic sets, bizarre costumes and stilted dialogue that tends toward the florid and metaphoric. An interesting and engaging series. Cast includes William Hurt, Alec Newman, Saskia Reeves, James Watson, Jan Vlasak, Giancarlo Giannini.

results.title: Dune. Episode 1
results.creator_credit: John Kent Harrison, David Kappes, New Amsterdam Entertainment and Sci Fi Channel
results.brief_description: Episode one of the American television mini-series adaptation of Frank Herbert’s cult novel “Dune.” The universe is ruled by an empire of noble groups: The Bene Gesserit, The Guild and the Great Houses, who compete for control of the planets, in particular the planet of Arrakis, a desert planet whose powerful spices are more valuable than gold. Emperor Shaddam IV has assigned Duke Leto Atreides and his family to take charge of Arrakis and the production of the spice. Once there however, the family face treachery from within their ranks and resentment from the local leaders. Letos’ bitter enemy Baron Vladimir Harkonnen invades Arrakis forcing the Duke’s lover and their son into the desert. Abandoned there, Paul discovers the true meaning of his destiny. Stylishly designed, this series certainly has an impressive aesthetic quality, ably capturing the otherworldliness of the book’s milieu, enhanced by extensive use of CGI. The mini-series format allows for a greater exploration of Herbert’s saga than the film version of “Dune” (Lynch, 1984). Like much science fiction, this futuristic tale has medieval and Biblical overtones with exotic sets, bizarre costumes and stilted dialogue that tends toward the florid and metaphoric. An interesting and engaging series. Cast includes William Hurt, Alec Newman, Saskia Reeves, James Watson, Jan Vlasak, Giancarlo Giannini.

results.title: Dune II: The Building of a Dynasty
results.brief_description: Dune II is often considered the first mainstream modern real-time strategy game and established many conventions of the genre. Even though set in Frank Herbert’s famous Dune universe, the game is only loosely connected to the book’s plot.

constellations_other.name: Webwurlds
constellations_other.description: Jess Johnson and Simon Ward's work is inspired by science fiction and fantasy. Johnson's hand-drawn illustrations are heavily detailed with geometric patterns and incorporate anthropomorphic characters amongst architectural environments in immersive other worlds.

results.title_for_label: Dune II: The Building of a Dynasty
results.description:
Dune II is often considered the first mainstream modern real-time strategy game and established many conventions of the genre. Even though set in Frank Herbert’s famous Dune universe, the game is only loosely connected to the plot of any of the books or the films based from them. Controlling either of the three Houses, the player must fight a number of battles against the other Houses. In the early levels, the goal is simply to earn a certain number of credits, while in the later missions, all enemies must be destroyed.

The single resource in the game is the Spice, which must be collected by harvesters. The spice is converted to credits in a refinery, which are then spent to construct additional buildings and units. There are two terrain types: buildings can only be constructed on stone, while the Spice is only found on sand. However, units moving on sand attract the large sandworms of Dune, who are virtually indestructible and can swallow even large units whole. As levels progress, new and more advanced buildings and units are made available, including structures like a radar station, a repair facility or defense turrets and, for units, various ground troops, light vehicles and tanks. Each House can construct one unique special unit, and, after building a palace improvement, can unleash a unique palace effect.
description_for_label:

Controlling either of the three Houses, the player must fight a number of battles against the other Houses. In the early levels, the goal is simply to earn a certain number of credits, while in the later missions, all enemies must be destroyed.

The single resource in the game is the Spice, which must be collected by harvesters. The spice is converted to credits in a refinery, which are then spent to construct additional buildings and units. There are two terrain types: buildings can only be constructed on stone, while the Spice is only found on sand. However, units moving on sand attract the large sandworms of Dune, who are virtually indestructible and can swallow even large units whole. As levels progress, new and more advanced buildings and units are made available, including structures like a radar station, a repair facility or defense turrets and, for units, various ground troops, light vehicles and tanks. Each House can construct one unique special unit, and, after building a palace improvement, can unleash a unique palace effect.

results.title: Dune
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Raffaella De Laurentiis and De Laurentiis Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: Based on Frank Herbert’s cult science fiction novel, “Dune” follows the fortune of Paul Atreides (Kyle Machlachan), whose family is persecuted by the Emperor (Jose Ferrer) and the evil Baron Harkonnen (Kenneth McMillan). Paul and his mother (Francesca Annis) seek refuge in the deserts of the planet Arakis. They join the Fremen who live under the desert sands. Soon the prophecy of a messiah becomes true as Paul leads the Fremen in battle against the forces controlling and manipulating their planet and the precious spice Melange. David Lynch manages to create a sense of the complex dynastical world which Frank Herbert had created in his popular novel, whilst retaining Lynch’s love for the bizarre and disturbing. A large international cast provides substance to this film, including Linda Hunt, Sian Phillips, Dean Stockwell, Jurgen Prochnow, Patrick Stewart, Sting and Freddie Jones.

results.title: Dunderklumpen
results.creator_credit: Paulette Rubinstein, Lynn Manwaring and G G Communications
results.brief_description: A magical trip into fantasyland, with Dunderklumpen and his mysterious friends who appear on a night filled with magic. Features a mixture of animation and real characters. Based on the original Swedish version, produced by Gunnar Karisson and directed by Per Ahlin. This American version is dubbed into English.

results.title: Dummy
results.brief_description: Pregnant with absence, ‘Dummy’ depicts desolate urban and suburban environments. Filmed in and around Melbourne, these everyday, expectant spaces are captured with formal elegance and an accidental beauty that reveals a unique insight into the secret and forgotten life of Melbourne.

results.title: Dumbo: a lesson in being prepared
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
Youngsters learn the pitfalls of trying things before they are prepared in this episode from Dumbo. Timothy Mouse pricks Dumbo with a pin to make him perform, despite the fact that Dumbo feels uncertain about his act. The result is a crashing failure that literally brings down the house. A charmingly anarchic affray, rendered with all the wide-eyed wonder of the Disney studio halcyon era.

results.title: Dumbo. Father Noah's ark. The Practical pig. Three orphan pigs.
results.brief_description: One of Disney’s most endearing animated films. Dumbo is the story of a baby circus animal born with oversized ears. Snubbed and ridiculed by all the other circus animals, he is befriended by Timothy, a small but spirited mouse. After Dumbo is involved in several disastrous performances under the big top, Timothy decides to launch Dumbo as a new star - the world’s only flying elephant. Also included in this program are three Disney cartoons: “Father Noah’s ark”, “The Practical pig”, and “Three orphan kittens”.
